# The basics {.transition}

Give the outline.

# models of L2 acquisition

slm, l2lp

# vowels in spanish vs english

typical issues for L1 English L2 Spanish
the focus: unstressed /a/ vs schwa

# methodology

10 participants shadowed 126 words that they believed to be Spanish. 
They repeated each word 3 times, for a total of 378 words per participant.
3780 words in total.
All words were bisyllabic paroxytones. The final vowel was always unstressed /a/.
Force alignment with Montreal Forced Aligner. Corrections have started.
FastTrack used. Set to 3 formants (so it prioritizes the first 3 formants). Extracts values every 2 ms.
Vowels were of different durations, so:
1. time was normalized
2. normalized times were binned into 11 bins
3. f1 and f2 averaged for each bin
4. plotted to f1xf2 space to see trajectory
